snippet: The ruling comes four years after a group of citizens filed a petition seeking to cancel  Jamaat-e-Islami’s registration, saying the party wants to introduce Shariah law.
abstract: Bangladesh’s High Court disqualifies country’s largest Islamic party, Jamaat-e-Islami, from taking part in 2014 general election, saying party’s charter conflicts with principles of nation’s secular Constitution.
lead_paragraph: The ruling comes four years after a group of citizens filed a petition seeking to cancel  Jamaat-e-Islami’s registration, saying the party wants to introduce Shariah law.

headline.main: Bangladesh: Islamic Party Banned From Taking Part in 2014 Election
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh: Islamic Party Banned From Taking Part in 2014 Election
